Package fr.istic.cartaylor.api

Interface CompatibilityManager

All Superinterfaces:
CompatibilityChecker
All Known Implementing Classes:
CompatibilityManagerImpl
public interface CompatibilityManager
extends CompatibilityChecker
A public interface allowing to system administrator to modify compatibilities and requirements between part types.
Author:
plouzeau

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addIncompatibilities​(PartType reference, java.util.Set<PartType> target)
    Add a set of incompatible part types to given part type.
    void addRequirements​(PartType reference, java.util.Set<PartType> target)
    Add a set of required part types to use with given part type.
    void removeIncompatibility​(PartType reference, PartType target)
    Remove an incompatibility between given part types.
    void removeRequirement​(PartType reference, PartType target)
    Remove a required part type for a given part type.

    Methods inherited from interface fr.istic.cartaylor.api.CompatibilityChecker

    getIncompatibilities, getRequirements

  • Method Details

    • addIncompatibilities

      void addIncompatibilities​(PartType reference, java.util.Set<PartType> target)
      Add a set of incompatible part types to given part type. The incompatibility is set in both direction for each reference-target association. If compatibilities already exist for given PartType, new compatibilities are added to existing ones. An incompatibility cannot be a requirement. A incompatible part type cannot be from the same category as reference.
      Parameters:
      reference - A part type
      target - All incompatible part types with reference
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Preconditions are not respected

    • removeIncompatibility

      void removeIncompatibility​(PartType reference, PartType target)
      Remove an incompatibility between given part types.
      Parameters:
      reference - First part type
      target - Second part type

    • addRequirements

      void addRequirements​(PartType reference, java.util.Set<PartType> target)
      Add a set of required part types to use with given part type. This means that reference needs all part types into target to be used. It does not specify if each part type into target needs reference to be used, or not. A requirement cannot be an incompatibility. A required part type cannot be from the same category as reference.
      Parameters:
      reference - Part type to use
      target - All required part types
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Preconditions are not respected

    • removeRequirement

      void removeRequirement​(PartType reference, PartType target)
      Remove a required part type for a given part type. This means that reference does not longer needs target to be used. It does not specify if target needs reference to be used, or not.
      Parameters:
      reference - Part type to use
      target - No longer required part type
